title: Beetles: 10 Spiritual Messages from the Insect World

steps.title: Strength and power.
steps.content: Strength and power. Their hard shells protect them from harm like a shield. Throughout time, many cultures have known and appreciated the strength and determination of beetles in the face of adversity. [1] X Research source Beetles can urge you to celebrate your strength and power under pressure.

steps.title: Change and transformation.
steps.content: Change and transformation. Beetles go through three stages of life, from larvae to adulthood. They sustain change gracefully and represent an ability to constantly learn and remember our potential to transform and embody new possibilities. [2] X Research source Beetles can be a reminder to seek out and embrace change .

steps.title: Good luck and prosperity.
steps.content: Good luck and prosperity. In many cultures, beetles are symbols of good fortune. In Chinese and some Native American folklore, beetles are associated with prosperity, wealth, and fertility. While some beetles are garden pests, others defend crops by eating more harmful insects, bringing growth and abundance. Beetles can be a sign that good luck and abundance are coming your way.

steps.title: Connection with the spiritual world.
steps.content: Connection with the spiritual world. For centuries, beetles have been associated with gods and the creation of life. As sacred animals that have awed people of all cultures and religions, beetles create strong connections between spiritual realms, our ancestors, and nature itself. [3] X Research source Beetles can be a reminder to honor your ancestors and connect to your spiritual side.

steps.title: Creation and new life.
steps.content: Creation and new life. Ancient Egyptians believed beetles were sacred, representing the creation of the world and essential for resurrection in the afterlife. Beetles also played an important role in the beliefs of some Native American groups, who believed beetles played an important role in the creation of the world. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Spiritual cleanliness.
steps.content: Spiritual cleanliness. Although beetles are often connected to dirt and sickness today, they’re actually natural cleaners of their environments. Some beetles remove dead plants and eat other animals’ feces, recycling the dead parts of nature so new life can be created. [5] X Research source Beetles can be a reminder to cleanse your spirit and leave our environments clean and healthy for our fellow animals and plants. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Teamwork and unity.
steps.content: Teamwork and unity. Some beetles rely on colonies to build their nests and survive. They work together to achieve their goals. [7] X Research source Beetles can be a reminder that you can accomplish more when united with others – we can all be much stronger when we’re not alone. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Nature’s rebirth.
steps.content: Nature’s rebirth. Many beetles contribute an important, positive role in the ecosystem. Some pollinate and promote the growth of plants, while others protect plants by eating harmful pests. Beetles can remind you to respect and be one with the natural world. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Adaptability.
steps.content: Adaptability. Beetles adapt well to new environments and develop impressive mechanisms to survive, working together with their colonies to get food and make their shelter. Beetles can remind you to dig beneath the surface and make changes to your life that will be beneficial in the long term. [10] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source

steps.title: Persistence and perseverance.
steps.content: Persistence and perseverance. They’ve been able to survive on earth for more than 300 million years, in nearly unlivable conditions. They stay resilient no matter what nature throws at them, and they can be a sign for you to do the same. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Dung beetles are connected with purification, duty, and patience.
steps.content: Dung beetles are connected with purification, duty, and patience. Dung beetles roll balls of animal feces up to 250 times their size, cleansing the environment with strength and determination. In Ancient Egypt, dung beetles were associated with the scarab god, Khepsis, who slowly rolled the sun into the sky each morning. If you’ve seen a scarab or dung beetle, take it as a reminder to be patient and take care of the natural world around you. In ancient Egypt, the scarab beetle also symbolized growth, rebirth, and development. This association with rebirth was so strong that when bodies were mummified after death, their hearts were replaced with a scarab amulet to help the person awaken in the afterlife.

steps.title: Green beetles can symbolize luck, fertility, and abundance.
steps.content: Green beetles can symbolize luck, fertility, and abundance. The color green is often associated with wealth or knowledge. Green also symbolizes the natural world and all the abundance the earth can bring. [12] X Trustworthy Source Penn State Extension Educational organization dedicated to delivering science-based information to people, businesses, and communities Go to source If you’ve seen a green beetle or dreamed about one, it could be a sign to take a chance and make a major change to your life or career. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Stag beetles can represent strength and music.
steps.content: Stag beetles can represent strength and music. In India, the stag beetle symbolizes courage and strength because of their hard shell and the long mandibles they use to fight. [14] X Research source According to Greek mythology, after he angered the gods, the musician Cerambus was turned into a stag beetle because their heads are the shape of the lyre he played. [15] X Research source If you come across a stag beetle, it could be a reminder to appreciate your strengths but to not let it all go to your head.

steps.title: June beetles are connected to change and renewal.
steps.content: June beetles are connected to change and renewal. June bugs are most active in the summertime, a period of growth, transition, and reflection. [16] X Research source A kind of scarab beetle, June beetles can represent personal regeneration. If you see a June bug, it can be a sign to embrace your complex and constantly transforming life – believe that things are changing for the better.

steps.title: It could be a sign to accept who you are.
steps.content: It could be a sign to accept who you are. It can feel comforting and a little mysterious to see such a small creature choose you and recognize that you exist. The beetle gives you permission to be completely and unapologetically yourself . When a beetle lands on you, it can remind you of the importance of practicing self-care and accepting who you are. [17] X Research source

steps.title: The beetle might be offering protection and good fortune.
steps.content: The beetle might be offering protection and good fortune. Many cultures throughout time have seen beetles as symbols of good luck and protection from evil. When a beetle lands on you, they offer protection from bad energy and invite fortune into your life. [18] X Research source

steps.title: It could be a sign of inner peace and compassion.
steps.content: It could be a sign of inner peace and compassion. Beetles wear their hard shells to protect the softness inside. If a beetle lands on you, they recognize your strength, but they also see the inner tranquility and kindness inside of you. [19] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source

steps.title: It could be a reminder to be determined and resilient.
steps.content: It could be a reminder to be determined and resilient. Beetles can be incredibly strong and hardworking. If one lands on you, it can be a sign to stay persistent and be determined to accomplish your tasks and achieve your goals . [20] X Research source

steps.title: It may be a sign that you need spiritual cleansing.
steps.content: It may be a sign that you need spiritual cleansing. Beetles are seen in places where filth and dirt build up. If a beetle lands on you, it could be a sign that you need to untangle and release the tension inside of you before you can make new growth . [21] X Research source

steps.title: It could be time to stop procrastinating.
steps.content: It could be time to stop procrastinating. If a beetle lands on you, it could be a sign that it’s time to take action and make a change. Be persistent, achieve your goals, and when an opportunity arrives at your door, be sure to answer it. [22] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source

steps.title: You may be entering a new cycle in your life.
steps.content: You may be entering a new cycle in your life. Beetles go through three different transformations in their life, from larvae to adulthood. If a beetle appears in your dream, it may be a sign of an upcoming change or metamorphosis in your life. Embrace this change with open arms – this is a chance to get out of your comfort zone and start a new adventure. [23] X Research source If the beetle in your dream is a type of scarab (like a dung or June beetle), it could symbolize birth, truth, or wisdom. Trust your intuition and welcome new possibilities into your life with open arms. [24] X Research source

steps.title: It may be time to think about your career or finances.
steps.content: It may be time to think about your career or finances. Dreams about beetles often symbolize money or something related to your career. If you dream about beetles, it could be a sign that a change to your career or financial situation is underway. Whether it’s a promotion, a new job, or a mysteriously large amount of money, something positive is headed your way. [25] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Fortune or good news may be headed your way.
steps.content: Fortune or good news may be headed your way. If your dream is pleasant and happy, it could be a sign that luck, wealth, and success are just around the corner.

steps.title: You might have unresolved trauma or worry.
steps.content: You might have unresolved trauma or worry. Although beetles are cleaners, they spend a lot of time rolling around in the dirt. If a beetle appears in your dream, it could be a sign that you have unresolved anger or trauma. You might also have trust issues with a person in your life. This dream can be a sign to let go of your anger and overcome your past trauma .
